location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No. 7 of 1855 from Captain Arnold Burrowes Kemball, Resident in the Persian Gulf, at Bushire to Henry Lacon Anderson, Secretary to the Government, Secret Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is reporting that Ameer Fysul [Amīr Fayṣul], the Wahabee [Wahabi] Chief, has indicated his concurrence respecting the reconciliation between Shaikh Mahomed bin Khuleefah [Muḥammed bin Khalīfah Āl Khalīfah], Chief of Bahrein [Bahrain], and Shaikh Mahomed bin Abdullah; though it notes he still considers Bahrein to be a dependency. It also briefly discusses the nature of the tribute paid by Bahrein to the Wahabee ruler.The item has two enclosures:1. Translation of a letter from Ameer Fysul, Wahabee Chief to the Resident in the Persian Gulf, dated 29 July 1855.2. Translation of a letter from the Resident in the Persian Gulf to Ameer Fysul, dated 10 August 1855.
